titleInfo.title: Brought to the Police Prison of the First District.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Police Prison of the First District-- CHARLES, a mulatto, about 18 years old, 5 feet 4 1/2 inches high ; says he belongs to Mr. Gurley. GEORGE, a black, about 8 years old, 4 feet 1/2 inches high; says he belongs to Mrs. Matilda Phillips. MARIA, a black, about 30 years old, 5 feet 3 inches high ; says she belongs to Mr. Bogar. EMMA, a mulattress, about 12 years old, 4 feet 7 inches high ; says she belongs to Mr. Avegno. WILLIAM, a light griff, about 30 years old, 5 feet 8 inches high, has a scar over right eye ; says he belongs to Mr. Woodruff. JOHN, a black, about 21 years old, 5 feet 8 3/4 inches high ; says he belongs to Mr. McLean. The Owners will please comply with the law respecting them. J. WORRALL, Warden. NewOrleans, May 7, 1852. my7 1aw3w
mods.note: Mr. Gurley; Mrs. Matilda Phillips; Mr. Bogar; Mr. Avegno; Mr. Woodruff; Mr. McLean

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
